body:
Good catch! Would you mind also to open an issue report at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NUTCH, to get this properly tracked and added to the release notes. Thanks.

Since the LinkDb is optional and not required to run the IndexingJob, needs to be discussed whether the intention wasn't originally

```
    if(args.containsKey(Nutch.ARG_LINKDB)){
      if(args.get(Nutch.ARG_LINKDB) != null) {
```

But add an empty directory as linkdb should not harm in any case. Your fix should work, thanks!
Hi, I have created an issue. You can find it at : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NUTCH-2324

Thanks, @sujen1412!  Probably, the index job was the first job which takes an optional argument. How the 3 possible values (custom path, default path, no linkdb) are encoded does not really matter. The way should be consistent. Currently we have:
1. key exists in args and value != null :: custom path
2. key does not exist :: default path (crawlId/linkdb or crawlId/crawldb etc.)

If we keep this unchanged and continue
1. key exists and value == null :: do not use

Btw., looks like linkdb is only half integrated: o.a.n.service.JobManager.JobType contains INVERTLINKS while o.a.n.webui.client.model.JobInfo.JobType doesn't?

Thank you @sebastian-nagel. Created an issue for implementing invertlinks in webui - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NUTCH-2326. 

What do you think about having it in this manner : 
1. key exists and value != null :: use custom path 
2. Key exists and value == null :: use default path ($crawlId/linkdb)
3. key does not exist :: do not use linkdb.
Ack'ed will try it out.

```
[artifact:mvn] Downloading: http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/mrunit/mrunit/1.1.0/mrunit-1.1.0.jar

[artifact:mvn]       mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=org.apache.mrunit -DartifactId=mrunit -Dversion=1.1.0 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file -Durl=[url] -DrepositoryId=[id]
[artifact:mvn]

[artifact:mvn]      1) org.apache.nutch:nutch:jar:1.13-SNAPSHOT
[artifact:mvn]      2) org.apache.mrunit:mrunit:jar:1.1.0
[artifact:mvn] 
[artifact:mvn] ----------
[artifact:mvn] 1 required artifact is missing.
```

The jar is not present here : http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/mrunit/mrunit/1.1.0/

Yes it is, it is at http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/mrunit/mrunit/1.1.0/mrunit-1.1.0-hadoop2.jar
You need to download it manually then run `mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=org.apache.mrunit -DartifactId=mrunit -Dversion=1.1.0 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=mrunit-1.1.0-hadoop2.jar`
The issue is a bug somewhere in Ant + Maven classifiers. I've experienced this for years but never been able to fix it.
tested with master branch. +1

+1 

... or take the jar fetched by ivy: `$HOME/.ivy2/cache/org.apache.mrunit/mrunit/jars/mrunit-1.1.0-hadoop2.jar`. The maven:classifier is not copied into the pom.xml. Ev. related to [IVY-1528](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IVY-1528) but this would need a very recent version of ivy.
What about squashing your commits and providing at least some explanations as to what you are trying to achieve?
@r0ann3l can you please open a ticket over on Jira? https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NUTCH, this will help us track it and assign it to a Nutch version.
[https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NUTCH-2333]?
@r0ann3l can you confirm please? The code in the pull request doesn't look like indexing code to me.

@lewismc and @jnioche this pull request isn't for NUTCH-2333. It's for NUTCH-2132. This code includes new properties to establish the connection with a RabbitMQ server, such as port, virtual host, user, password. Also includes a queue.name and a queue.durable properties. Besides, I include the reference to amqp-client library in plugin.xml file for publish-rabbitmq plugin.

I get the following exception in the CleaningJob

```
Error: java.lang.IllegalStateException: bulk process already closed
        at org.elasticsearch.action.bulk.BulkProcessor.ensureOpen(BulkProcessor.java:278)
        at org.elasticsearch.action.bulk.BulkProcessor.flush(BulkProcessor.java:329)
        at org.apache.nutch.indexwriter.elastic.ElasticIndexWriter.commit(ElasticIndexWriter.java:198)
        at org.apache.nutch.indexer.IndexWriters.commit(IndexWriters.java:125)
        at org.apache.nutch.indexer.CleaningJob$DeleterReducer.close(CleaningJob.java:123)
        at org.apache.hadoop.io.IOUtils.cleanup(IOUtils.java:244)
        at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.ReduceTask.runOldReducer(ReduceTask.java:467)
        at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.ReduceTask.run(ReduceTask.java:393)
        at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.YarnChild$2.run(YarnChild.java:164)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at javax.security.auth.Subject.doAs(Subject.java:422)
        at org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation.doAs(UserGroupInformation.java:1657)
        at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.YarnChild.main(YarnChild.java:158)
```

I applied this patch and now the clean job runs without error.

Should the "Num Docs" count in my core stats change after a successful clean?

The clean job returned "SolrIndexer: deleting 28/28 documents", but the "Num Docs" count didn't change.
Hi @kamaci I cannot pull this PR, it hails from 'unknown repository'. Any ideas?

Hi @kamaci, have you tested whether this still allows to iterate over all records of an [ARC file](http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual/arcs.html)? I suspect that GZipInputStream.close() will implicitly close the underlying FSDataInputStream which would cause that any subsequent records are skipped. Usually every ARC record is compressed on its own, that's why a new GZipInputStream is used per record.
Thanks for the careful analysis and the other unifications made: always use LOG, replace commons logging by slf4j.
@sebastian-nagel are you suggesting that each message is customized?

Explicitly logging the exception class is redundant, e.g.:
```
2017-01-18 18:25:02,575 ERROR parse.ParseUtil - MalformedURLException occurred: 
java.net.MalformedURLException: no protocol: ://example.com/
        at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:593)
        ...
```
Without a meaningful message we could also log:
```
LOG.error(StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
```
A message which explaines what went wrong would be better. But as I said, it's a further improvement. :)

@sebastian-nagel I've closed the input stream at finally block. It causes a memory leak when you don't close such input streams. unzipBestEffort method at GZIPUtils.java also closes the input stream at such case. 

I can add a test method test to explicitly test it (or do it manually) whether it causes an unintended case or not if you can guide me about how we can understand it?
@sebastian-nagel I've created this PR instead of the other one.
@sebastian-nagel @lewismc  I've created another PR to get a better logging. I'll close this one.
Excellent, looks good. Thanks!
@sebastian-nagel OK, then I'm closing the PR.
I'm closing this PR since it's been fixed by my merged PR: https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/172
Does anyone have an objection to merging this PR into master? Thank you for the patch and explanation above @bmzhao
This is great @kamaci I've pulled this locally, all compiles and tests fine. Does anyone have objections merging into master?
@lewismc you can merge it into master ;)
Nice @jorgelbg +1
+1  (build and tests are ok, no javadoc errors)
+1, @kamaci do you have write permissions yet? If so then please merge into master.
thanks @kamaci merged into master in https://github.com/apache/nutch/commit/3e2d3d456489bf52bc586dae0e2e71fb7aad8fe7
LGTM!
@sebastian-nagel is this ready to commit?

Almost ready, in my last commit 461fde3 I made a quick fix which needs to be reviewed and cleaned up. I'll do this today. The code was in production a couple of times (crawled over 100 million pages). I'll also double check the modifications in tools which haven't been tested in production (linkdb and indexer). Thanks!
Ok, ready now from my side.
This contribution makes a lot of sense, moving out of the transport protocol makes a lot of sense. however I find missing why not also update to a newer version? being on 1.4.1 is a very old one.
I amend myself the 1.4 is in the old 1.x branch, not in the new one. however also good that the code might be updated to latest versions so for example can benefit from the java rest client.
@purbon I think we can make the upgrades in a separate pull request.

Good catch, thanks! Would you mind open also an issue on the [Apache Nutch issue tracker](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NUTCH)? Just to make sure the fix is tracked and added to the release notes.
Merged into 2.x.

+1 for me @jnioche 
@sebastian-nagel you had made a comment over on NUTCH-2046, are you happy with this approach? I've tested in locally and like it.
+1 from my side, but we could add a note to CHANGES.txt (as part of a section about API-breaking changes). Users need to update scripts calling bin/crawl.

+1

@chrismattmann can you review please?
I've used `HBase-0.98.18-hadoop2` version and APIs. I was really confused which HBase version should I use? Should I use HBase 1.x ? Please review the changes.

Excellent @Omkar20895 thank you for starting this pull request. Now you will see that EVERY class is broken e.g. does not compile... lets gradually fix those classes. Please update this PR as you progress. Thank you for submitting PR early it makes a huge difference for review.
We could also improve with parameterized logging in due course. I wanted to post this patch as a mechanism for relighting the interest in Sitemap parsing with master branch.
@Omkar20895 please keep the updates coming as we can review the code incrementally. Thanks.
@lewismc I am working on upgrading crawldb, I will send the update as soon as I am done with it. Thanks.
Thanks, @lewismc!

CrawlDb needs to be updated more, this will be done in the coming weeks. Major changes still need to be done in DeDuplicationJob.java, Thanks. 
@lewismc
Very frustrating for newcomers like me. Not even a single initial response :( :'(

Hi @kaidul, sorry about any delays. We are a small projects and a small community and a careful review including a test setup will take its time. I hope to get some hours during this week but cannot promise anything. 

Regarding the HBase version: Gora 0.6.1 uses HBase 0.98.8, to avoid any conflicts (if Hbase is used also for storage via Gora) it's for sure not a bad idea to use the same version. But I do not feel really competent in any questions regarding Gora.

Hi @sebastian-nagel , Really thanks for your response. Always appreciate your effort and sorry for my impatience. Without no initial response, I thought my PR might seem somewhat irrelevant for Nutch. Now I know, this PR is on the queue no matter how many days to wait :)

Yes, Fortunately [my current PR uses hbase `0.98.8-hadoop2`](https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/184/files#diff-34c6548df1ed381822e7318fa954bfda) (sorry for I mistakenly mentioned `0.98.18` which is not correct), so I think this is the same version with gora 0.6.1.

Hi @kaidul, I'm currently porting this to Nutch 1.x branch. During testing I found that there's a commit() missing in the close() function. Because of this, the last batch isn't committed. Can you change this aswell?
Hi @sju Thanks for your participation. I've added the `commit()` on `close()` and pushed it.
@lewismc please review the latest commit so that I can incorporate the changes suggested by you.

Hi @lewismc. Thank you for your review.

Sorry for my late reply.
I have tried the new stores of Gora 0.7, results are below.

| DataStore | Result | Description |
|-----------|---------|-------------|
| JCache     | NG         |  Preparing patch for Gora |
| Infinispan  | NG        | Under investigation. Error occurred in client |
| CouchDB  | NG         | Problem with update the document. Is MapReduce unsupported?※ |
| DynamoDB | NG       | Conflicting with AWS client library. Is MapReduce unsupported?※ |

※There is no MapReduce integration test in the repository of Gora 0.7.

JCacheStore works by rebuild classes of storage and applying patch to Gora to disable CacheEntryListener,
Others are under investigation.

By the way, with HBaseStore at this PR code base, It worked.
InfinispanStore is investigating, but it takes much time. May I assume that CouchDB and DynamoDB are out of the scope Nutch 2.4?

@cloudysunny14 what does RESULT NG mean?

> By the way, with HBaseStore at this PR code base, It worked.

great

> InfinispanStore is investigating, but it takes much time. May I assume that CouchDB and DynamoDB are out of the scope Nutch 2.4?

Yes that is absolutely fine.

> JCacheStore works by rebuild classes of storage and applying patch to Gora to disable CacheEntryListener,

Can you point me to this PR please?

@sebastian-nagel I've addressed all but two of your comments and responded. I've also implemented parameterized logging. In addition, I've dropped the STATUS_SITEMAP replacing instances with STATUS_INJECTED.
N.B. when I run this as follows i am not currently able to inject any URLs into the CrawlDB
```
//First I inject a random URL to create a CrawlDB

lmcgibbn@LMC-056430 /usr/local/nutch(NUTCH-1465) $ ./runtime/local/bin/nutch inject crawl urls/
Injector: starting at 2017-05-18 23:01:14
Injector: crawlDb: crawl
Injector: urlDir: urls
Injector: Converting injected urls to crawl db entries.
Injector: overwrite: false
Injector: update: false
Injector: Total urls rejected by filters: 0
Injector: Total urls injected after normalization and filtering: 1
Injector: Total urls injected but already in CrawlDb: 0
Injector: Total new urls injected: 1
Injector: finished at 2017-05-18 23:01:15, elapsed: 00:00:01

// I then, attempt to process a sitemap at http://www.autotrader.com/sitemap.xml which I've added to a file located in a 'sitemaps' directory

lmcgibbn@LMC-056430 /usr/local/nutch(NUTCH-1465) $ ./runtime/local/bin/nutch sitemap crawl -sitemapUrls sitemaps
SitemapProcessor: sitemap urls dir: sitemaps
SitemapProcessor: Starting at 2017-05-18 23:06:38
robots.txt whitelist not configured.
SitemapProcessor: Total records rejected by filters: 0
SitemapProcessor: Total sitemaps from HostDb: 0
SitemapProcessor: Total sitemaps from seed urls: 1
SitemapProcessor: Total failed sitemap fetches: 0
SitemapProcessor: Total new sitemap entries added: 0
SitemapProcessor: Finished at 2017-05-18 23:06:48, elapsed: 00:00:10

// Lets read the DB

lmcgibbn@LMC-056430 /usr/local/nutch(NUTCH-1465) $ ./runtime/local/bin/nutch readdb crawl -stats
CrawlDb statistics start: crawl
Statistics for CrawlDb: crawl
TOTAL urls:	1
shortest fetch interval:	30 days, 00:00:00
avg fetch interval:	30 days, 00:00:00
longest fetch interval:	30 days, 00:00:00
earliest fetch time:	Thu May 18 23:01:00 PDT 2017
avg of fetch times:	Thu May 18 23:01:00 PDT 2017
latest fetch time:	Thu May 18 23:01:00 PDT 2017
retry 0:	1
min score:	1.0
avg score:	1.0
max score:	1.0
status 1 (db_unfetched):	1
CrawlDb statistics: done
```
As you can see no URLs seem to be processed as the new sitemap entries added is zero, this is confirmed by the readdb output.
I need to do some more debugging and see where the bug(s) are. If anyone is able to try this patch out and has an interest in Sitemap support in Nutch master it would be highly appreciated.
Any objections to commit to master?
Duplicate PR @sebastian-nagel, please reopen if this is the case

Hi @kaidul yes I shadow @sebastian-nagel comments, apologies for not getting around to this earlier. It is not because the committers don't care, it may have to do with the fact that not everyone has HBase running... regardless thank you for the patch. I managed to try it out with HBase 0.98.X tonight and I am glad to report that it performed flawlessly.
The only comment I really have is if you could implement [parameterized logging](https://www.slf4j.org/faq.html#logging_performance) for Slf4j logging instances.
Thanks again, if you are able to address the logging issue then I would more than happily commit this to master branch.
@cloudysunny14 ping, I would like to work with you to shepherd this code into 2.X branch.
This one is for 1.x/master, #187 is for 2.x. Sorry, the next time I'll also add a statement to which branch the PR applies. Thanks for the review!

Hi @lewismc Thanks for your effort to test my patch and I am very glad that everything worked perfectly and the PR is more likely to be merged :D I've added parameterized logging where possible and pushed the changes. However, [here](https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/184/files#diff-ed9e59402a5d1e6a0f39361b2429e580R97) and [here](https://github.com/apache/nutch/pull/184/files#diff-ed9e59402a5d1e6a0f39361b2429e580R91), the log-messages need to be created to throw `RuntimeException` no matter log is enabled or not. So I used `String.format` here.

Please let me know what you're thinking :)

Sorry Seb

Hi @lewismc.
I appreciate your reply, and I'm so sorry for not replying sooner.

> what does RESULT NG mean?

OK: The crawl cycle finishes normally.
NG: The crawl cycle interruption due to an error.

> Can you point me to this PR please?

I am planning to make CacheEntryListener disable by configuration but it is under consideration.
I will create issue about JCacheStore in the Gora's JIRA.

Also, added license header according to your feedback.

Thank you.
OK I will also test some of the datastores shortly, thank you

No it's okday now. Thank you for the contribution. If you feel like contributing to Nutch again please open a JIRA issue Thank you very much for the contribution.
